name: Verify that the Expiry Date is taken from the Documents Maintenance Page and is displayed in the format DD/MM/YYYY
justification: This test case involves data display and formatting, which is important but does not involve multiple components, user roles, or complex processes. Therefore, it meets only the complexity and critical business process criteria.

name: Verify that when View is clicked, the pop is to appear of the document
justification: This test case ensures the functionality of viewing documents, a basic feature with moderate impact but does not cover multiple components or complex processes. It meets the critical business process and integration points criteria.

name: Verify that in the Action Column, no upload is shown as ‘No action required’
justification: This test case is more about UI display and less about critical functionality or integrations, meeting only the critical business process criterion.

name: Verify that in the Action Column, where there is an upload for the document type, green tick = verified document
justification: This is relevant to document verification, which is a common task but not particularly complex or broad in coverage. It meets the critical process and basic integration criteria.

name: Verify in the Action Column, when the green tick is clicked, the tick and ‘x’ will be replaced by the word ‘Verified’
justification: This test is more focused on the UI interaction and display updates which are important for user experience but not critical at a system level. It meets the UI validation and user interaction criteria.

name: Verify that when the document is verified, an email is to be sent to the Agency users confirming the client name and document that was verified
justification: This test covers security (email notifications), integration (email services), critical processes, and multiple user roles (Agency users), making it a high-priority candidate.

name: Verify that the email template to verify is correct
justification: Template validation is crucial for correct communication; it covers security and critical business process but is less about integration or user roles. This meets critical process, data manipulation, and security criteria.

name: Verify that when the Rex ‘X’ is clicked, the tick and ‘x’ will be removed and replaced by the word ‘Rejected’
justification: This test is about UI interaction and display changes. It's important but not critical. It meets UI validation and user interaction criteria.

name: Verify that when a document is rejected, an email will be sent to the agency users to notify that the document was rejected
justification: This covers critical business processes, involves security (notifications), and integrates email services, making it a high-priority candidate. It meets critical process, security, and integration points criteria.

name: Verify that the email template to reject is correct
justification: Similar to UNO-T309, template validation is important. It covers critical processes and security but is less about overall system complexity. It meets critical process, security, and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify the edit function on the default document list table
justification: Editing functionality covers critical business operations and involves some complexity in data manipulation but doesn't have significant security implications. It meets critical process, data manipulation, and integration points criteria.

name: Verify the delete function on the default document list table
justification: Delete functionality is crucial, involving data integrity and business impact. It meets critical process, data manipulation, and security criteria but has less complexity in terms of integration points.

name: Verify that the document type is a dropdown box.
testScript:
Given: 

  • Logged in as an Agency User 

When: 

  • On the worker’s page 

Then:  

  • The document type is a drop-down list which I populated from the Document Type Name Maintenance
justification: Ensuring the correct control type is important for UI consistency but less critical in terms of system functionality. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that document names cannot be duplicated.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as an Agency User 
When:
  •  On the worker’s page 
Then:
  • Try and add new document with duplicated data, there should be an erro message preventing you form doing this.
justification: Preventing duplicates is critical for data integrity and involves backend validation, meeting critical process, data manipulation, and security criteria.

name: Verify that there is a group dropdown on the worker documents page.
testScript:
Given:
  • Logged in as an Agency User 
When:
  • On the worker’s page 
Then: 
  • All groups are an option. 
  • Drop down to be populated with the job type group name from group column in client Job types page.
  • There is no multi select option for the group dropdown.
justification: This ensures group filtering functionality, which affects user roles and process flow. It meets critical process, integration points, and user role criteria.

name: Verify that there cannot be duplicates in the worker documents maintenance page
testScript:
Given: 

  • Logged in as an Agency User 

When: 

  • On the worker’s page 

Then:

  • Try adding or editing a document name to one that already exists, there should be an error message preventing you from doing this.
justification: Similar to UNO-T316, this ensures data integrity and backend validation, meeting critical process, data manipulation, and security criteria.

name: Verify that the page can’t have duplicates such as same client, group document type creation.
testScript:
Given: 

  • Logged in as an Agency User 

When: 

  • On the worker’s page 

Then:

  • try and create a duplicate group o for the same client , there should be an error message preventing this.
justification: Ensures no duplication across multiple aspects (client, group, document type), affecting data integrity. It meets critical process, data manipulation, and security criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays Document Type
justification: Verifying display features is important but has less business impact and complexity. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays File Name
justification: Verifying display features is important but has less business impact and complexity. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the table displays View hyperlink
justification: Ensuring hyperlinks are displayed correctly affects navigation but is a basic functionality. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the Verified column is no longer appearing on the table
justification: This involves ensuring proper display of table columns, which is significant for UI but not deeply impacting the system. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that the expiry date is displayed on the table
justification: Verification of data display (expiry date) is important but less complex. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify that the expiry date displays the expiry date in red and if no expiry date was selected, N/A is displayed
justification: Additional formatting and data display checks improve user experience but are not critical. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.

name: Verify that the Mandatory column is on the table
justification: Ensuring the presence of critical UI elements (mandatory column) for data verification. It meets critical process and UI validation criteria.

name: Verify that if the document type was marked mandatory in the defaults documents page, yes is displayed
justification: Verification of mandatory field marking is important but has lower complexity and integration. It meets critical process and data manipulation criteria.
